title: Thug Life: Kamal Haasan apologises to fans for not collaborating with Mani Ratnam earlier
summary: Kamal Haasan and director Mani Ratnam are reuniting after 37 years for 'Thug Life', releasing June 5. At a music launch event, Haasan apologized for the long gap since their last collaboration 'Nayakan' (1987), explaining they were waiting for the right script. He praised Ratnam's work ethic and revealed his nickname for the director.
content:
Ace director Mani Ratnam and Indian star Kamal Haasan are reuniting together on screen after a whopping 37 years. After the stunning Nayakan in 1987, the two stalwarts are back together for Thug Life which is all set to release on June 5. On Friday, the Thug Life team launched a single from the film called Jinguchaa at an event in Chennai.

Speaking at the event, Kamal Haasan opened up about why the two never got to work together again after Nayakan and even apologised. "Nothing has changed between Mani Ratnam and me even after all these years. It's our fault for waiting for so long to come together. We were in search of better scripts and it took this long for us to collaborate."

Kamal Haasan, who has co-written Thug Life with Mani Ratnam, also added that he was reminded of working with renowned director K Balachander, his mentor and guru, when working with Mani Ratnam. He revealed his nickname for Ratnam - 'Anju ara' (meaning 5.30 am) due to his early arrival on set every day.

The film features an ensemble cast including Trisha, Silambarasan, Joju George, Ashok Selvan, Nasser, and Abhirami. The music is composed by AR Rahman, with cinematography by Ravi K Chandran and editing by A Sreekar Prasad. The film is a joint production of Raaj Kamal Films International, Madras Talkies and Red Giant Movies.
